result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thaddeus John Smith

records.addlTxt: Filed by DA Office Erin M. arc

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Megan S.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats. THIS CONDITION SHALL ONLY BE EFFECTIVE UPON THE EXPIRATION OF A 72 HOUR NO CONTACT ORDER.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

2:00 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson,  Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thaddeus John Smith in court. DE received copy of complaint, updates address. DE indicates he would like to represent himself. RECESS. 2:08 PM - Case recalled. Appearances as previously noted. Court reviews Waiver of Counsel form completed by DE. Ct finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives counsel and is competent to represent himself. Court sets bond. NG. Court sets PSC. Adjourned: 2:12 PM. kma
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
